003package choreo;
004
005import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
006import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Alert.AlertType.kError;
007
008import choreo.trajectory.DifferentialSample;
009import choreo.trajectory.EventMarker;
010import choreo.trajectory.ProjectFile;
011import choreo.trajectory.SwerveSample;
012import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
013import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
014import com.google.gson.Gson;
015import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;
016import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
017import com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException;
018import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
019import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Alert;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
022import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Filesystem;
023import java.io.BufferedReader;
024import java.io.File;
025import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
026import java.io.FileReader;
027import java.io.IOException;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import java.util.HashMap;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Map;
033import java.util.Optional;
034import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
035import java.util.function.Function;
036
037/** Utilities to load and follow Choreo Trajectories */
038public final class Choreo {
039  private static final Gson GSON =
040      new GsonBuilder()
041          .registerTypeAdapter(EventMarker.class, new EventMarker.Deserializer())
042          .create();
043  private static final String TRAJECTORY_FILE_EXTENSION = ".traj";
044  private static final int TRAJ_SCHEMA_VERSION = 0;
045  private static final int PROJECT_SCHEMA_VERSION = 1;
046  private static final MultiAlert cantFindTrajectory =
047      multiAlert(causes -> "Could not find trajectory files: " + causes, kError);
048  private static final MultiAlert cantParseTrajectory =
049      multiAlert(causes -> "Could not parse trajectory files: " + causes, kError);
050
051  private static File CHOREO_DIR = new File(Filesystem.getDeployDirectory(), "choreo");
052
053  private static Optional<ProjectFile> LAZY_PROJECT_FILE = Optional.empty();
054
055  /** This should only be used for unit testing. */
056  static void setChoreoDir(File choreoDir) {
057    CHOREO_DIR = choreoDir;
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * Gets the project file from the deploy directory. Choreolib expects a .chor file to be placed in
062   * src/main/deploy/choreo.
063   *
064   * <p>The result is cached after the first call.
065   *
066   * @return the project file
067   */
068  public static ProjectFile getProjectFile() {
069    if (LAZY_PROJECT_FILE.isPresent()) {
070      return LAZY_PROJECT_FILE.get();
071    }
072    try {
073      // find the first file that ends with a .chor extension
074      File[] projectFiles = CHOREO_DIR.listFiles((dir, name) -> name.endsWith(".chor"));
075      if (projectFiles.length == 0) {
076        throw new RuntimeException("Could not find project file in deploy directory");
077      } else if (projectFiles.length > 1) {
078        throw new RuntimeException("Found multiple project files in deploy directory");
079      }
080      BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(projectFiles[0]));
081      String str = reader.lines().reduce("", (a, b) -> a + b);
082      reader.close();
083      JsonObject json = GSON.fromJson(str, JsonObject.class);
084      int version;
085      try {
086        version = json.get("version").getAsInt();
087        if (version != PROJECT_SCHEMA_VERSION) {
088          throw new RuntimeException(
089              ".chor project file: Wrong version "
090                  + version
091                  + ". Expected "
092                  + PROJECT_SCHEMA_VERSION);
093        }
094      } catch (ClassCastException e) {
095        throw new RuntimeException(
096            ".chor project file: Wrong version "
097                + json.get("version").getAsString()
098                + ". Expected "
099                + PROJECT_SCHEMA_VERSION);
100      }
101      LAZY_PROJECT_FILE = Optional.of(GSON.fromJson(str, ProjectFile.class));
102    } catch (JsonSyntaxException ex) {
103      throw new RuntimeException("Could not parse project file", ex);
104    } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
105      throw new RuntimeException("Could not find project file", ex);
106    } catch (IOException ex) {
107      throw new RuntimeException("Could not close the project file", ex);
108    }
109    return LAZY_PROJECT_FILE.get();
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * This interface exists as a type alias. A TrajectoryLogger has a signature of ({@link
114   * Trajectory}, {@link Boolean})-&gt;void, where the function consumes a trajectory and a boolean
115   * indicating whether the trajectory is starting or finishing.
116   *
117   * @param <SampleType> DifferentialSample or SwerveSample.
118   */
119  public interface TrajectoryLogger<SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>>
120      extends BiConsumer<Trajectory<SampleType>, Boolean> {}
121
122  /** Default constructor. */
123  private Choreo() {
124    throw new UnsupportedOperationException("This is a utility class!");
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Load a trajectory from the deploy directory. Choreolib expects .traj files to be placed in
129   * src/main/deploy/choreo/[trajectoryName].traj.
130   *
131   * @param <SampleType> The type of samples in the trajectory.
132   * @param trajectoryName The path name in Choreo, which matches the file name in the deploy
133   *     directory, file extension is optional.
134   * @return The loaded trajectory, or `Optional.empty()` if the trajectory could not be loaded.
135   */
136  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
137  public static <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>>
138      Optional<Trajectory<SampleType>> loadTrajectory(String trajectoryName) {
139    requireNonNullParam(trajectoryName, "trajectoryName", "Choreo.loadTrajectory");
140
141    if (trajectoryName.endsWith(TRAJECTORY_FILE_EXTENSION)) {
142      trajectoryName =
143          trajectoryName.substring(0, trajectoryName.length() - TRAJECTORY_FILE_EXTENSION.length());
144    }
145    File trajectoryFile = new File(CHOREO_DIR, trajectoryName + TRAJECTORY_FILE_EXTENSION);
146    try {
147      var reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(trajectoryFile));
148      String str = reader.lines().reduce("", (a, b) -> a + b);
149      reader.close();
150      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory =
151          (Trajectory<SampleType>) loadTrajectoryString(str, getProjectFile());
152      return Optional.of(trajectory);
153    } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
154      cantFindTrajectory.addCause(trajectoryFile.toString());
155    } catch (JsonSyntaxException ex) {
156      cantParseTrajectory.addCause(trajectoryFile.toString());
157    } catch (Exception ex) {
158      Choreo.alert(
159              "Unknown error when parsing " + trajectoryFile + "; check console for more details",
160              kError)
161          .set(true);
162      DriverStation.reportError(ex.getMessage(), ex.getStackTrace());
163    }
164    return Optional.empty();
165  }
166
167  /**
168   * Load a trajectory from a string.
169   *
170   * @param trajectoryJsonString The JSON string.
171   * @param projectFile The project file.
172   * @return The loaded trajectory, or `empty std::optional` if the trajectory could not be loaded.
173   */
174  static Trajectory<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> loadTrajectoryString(
175      String trajectoryJsonString, ProjectFile projectFile) {
176    JsonObject wholeTrajectory = GSON.fromJson(trajectoryJsonString, JsonObject.class);
177    String name = wholeTrajectory.get("name").getAsString();
178    int version;
179    try {
180      version = wholeTrajectory.get("version").getAsInt();
181      if (version != TRAJ_SCHEMA_VERSION) {
182        throw new RuntimeException(
183            name + ".traj: Wrong version: " + version + ". Expected " + TRAJ_SCHEMA_VERSION);
184      }
185    } catch (ClassCastException e) {
186      throw new RuntimeException(
187          name
188              + ".traj: Wrong version: "
189              + wholeTrajectory.get("version").getAsString()
190              + ". Expected "
191              + TRAJ_SCHEMA_VERSION);
192    }
193    // Filter out markers with negative timestamps or empty names
194    List<EventMarker> unfilteredEvents =
195        new ArrayList<EventMarker>(
196            Arrays.asList(GSON.fromJson(wholeTrajectory.get("events"), EventMarker[].class)));
197    unfilteredEvents.removeIf(marker -> marker.timestamp < 0 || marker.event.length() == 0);
198    EventMarker[] events = new EventMarker[unfilteredEvents.size()];
199    unfilteredEvents.toArray(events);
200
201    JsonObject trajectoryObj = wholeTrajectory.getAsJsonObject("trajectory");
202    Integer[] splits = GSON.fromJson(trajectoryObj.get("splits"), Integer[].class);
203    if (splits.length == 0 || splits[0] != 0) {
204      Integer[] newArray = new Integer[splits.length + 1];
205      newArray[0] = 0;
206      System.arraycopy(splits, 0, newArray, 1, splits.length);
207      splits = newArray;
208    }
209    if (projectFile.type.equals("Swerve")) {
210      HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ChoreoTrajectory, 1);
211
212      SwerveSample[] samples = GSON.fromJson(trajectoryObj.get("samples"), SwerveSample[].class);
213      return new Trajectory<SwerveSample>(name, List.of(samples), List.of(splits), List.of(events));
214    } else if (projectFile.type.equals("Differential")) {
215      HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ChoreoTrajectory, 2);
216
217      DifferentialSample[] sampleArray =
218          GSON.fromJson(trajectoryObj.get("samples"), DifferentialSample[].class);
219      return new Trajectory<DifferentialSample>(
220          name, List.of(sampleArray), List.of(splits), List.of(events));
221    } else {
222      throw new RuntimeException("Unknown project type: " + projectFile.type);
223    }
224  }
225
226  /**
227   * A utility for caching loaded trajectories. This allows for loading trajectories only once, and
228   * then reusing them.
229   */
230  public static class TrajectoryCache {
231    private final Map<String, Trajectory<?>> cache;
232
233    /** Creates a new TrajectoryCache with a normal {@link HashMap} as the cache. */
234    public TrajectoryCache() {
235      cache = new HashMap<>();
236    }
237
238    /**
239     * Creates a new TrajectoryCache with a custom cache.
240     *
241     * <p>this could be useful if you want to use a concurrent map or a map with a maximum size.
242     *
243     * @param cache The cache to use.
244     */
245    public TrajectoryCache(Map<String, Trajectory<?>> cache) {
246      requireNonNullParam(cache, "cache", "TrajectoryCache.<init>");
247      this.cache = cache;
248    }
249
250    /**
251     * Load a trajectory from the deploy directory. Choreolib expects .traj files to be placed in
252     * src/main/deploy/choreo/[trajectoryName].traj.
253     *
254     * <p>This method will cache the loaded trajectory and reused it if it is requested again.
255     *
256     * @param trajectoryName the path name in Choreo, which matches the file name in the deploy
257     *     directory, file extension is optional.
258     * @return the loaded trajectory, or `Optional.empty()` if the trajectory could not be loaded.
259     * @see Choreo#loadTrajectory(String)
260     */
261    public Optional<? extends Trajectory<?>> loadTrajectory(String trajectoryName) {
262      requireNonNullParam(trajectoryName, "trajectoryName", "TrajectoryCache.loadTrajectory");
263      if (cache.containsKey(trajectoryName)) {
264        return Optional.of(cache.get(trajectoryName));
265      } else {
266        return Choreo.loadTrajectory(trajectoryName)
267            .map(
268                trajectory -> {
269                  cache.put(trajectoryName, trajectory);
270                  return trajectory;
271                });
272      }
273    }
274
275    /**
276     * Load a section of a split trajectory from the deploy directory. Choreolib expects .traj files
277     * to be placed in src/main/deploy/choreo/[trajectoryName].traj.
278     *
279     * <p>This method will cache the loaded trajectory and reused it if it is requested again. The
280     * trajectory that is split off of will also be cached.
281     *
282     * @param trajectoryName the path name in Choreo, which matches the file name in the deploy
283     *     directory, file extension is optional.
284     * @param splitIndex the index of the split trajectory to load
285     * @return the loaded trajectory, or `Optional.empty()` if the trajectory could not be loaded.
286     * @see Choreo#loadTrajectory(String)
287     */
288    public Optional<? extends Trajectory<?>> loadTrajectory(String trajectoryName, int splitIndex) {
289      requireNonNullParam(trajectoryName, "trajectoryName", "TrajectoryCache.loadTrajectory");
290      // make the key something that could never possibly be a valid trajectory name
291      String key = trajectoryName + ".:." + splitIndex;
292      if (cache.containsKey(key)) {
293        return Optional.of(cache.get(key));
294      } else if (cache.containsKey(trajectoryName)) {
295        return cache
296            .get(trajectoryName)
297            .getSplit(splitIndex)
298            .map(
299                trajectory -> {
300                  cache.put(key, trajectory);
301                  return trajectory;
302                });
303      } else {
304        return Choreo.loadTrajectory(trajectoryName)
305            .flatMap(
306                trajectory -> {
307                  cache.put(trajectoryName, trajectory);
308                  return trajectory
309                      .getSplit(splitIndex)
310                      .map(
311                          split -> {
312                            cache.put(key, split);
313                            return split;
314                          });
315                });
316      }
317    }
318
319    /** Clear the cache. */
320    public void clear() {
321      cache.clear();
322    }
323  }
324
325  /**
326   * Creates an alert under the "Choreo" group.
327   *
328   * @param name The name of the alert
329   * @param type The type of alert
330   * @return an Alert published under the "Choreo" group
331   */
332  public static Alert alert(String name, Alert.AlertType type) {
333    return new Alert("Choreo", name, type);
334  }
335
336  /**
337   * Creates a {@link MultiAlert} under the "Choreo" group.
338   *
339   * @param textGenerator A function that accepts a list of causes and returns an alert message
340   * @param type The type of alert
341   * @return a MultiAlert published under the "Choreo" group
342   */
343  public static MultiAlert multiAlert(
344      Function<List<String>, String> textGenerator, Alert.AlertType type) {
345    return new MultiAlert(textGenerator, type);
346  }
347
348  /**
349   * An alert that can have multiple causes. Utilizes a function to generate an error message from a
350   * list of causes.
351   */
352  public static class MultiAlert extends Alert {
353    private final Function<List<String>, String> textGenerator;
354    private final List<String> causes = new ArrayList<>();
355
356    MultiAlert(Function<List<String>, String> textGenerator, AlertType type) {
357      super("Choreo", textGenerator.apply(List.of()), type);
358      this.textGenerator = textGenerator;
359    }
360
361    /**
362     * Adds an error causer to this alert, and pushes the alert to networktables if it is not
363     * already present.
364     *
365     * @param name The name of the error causer
366     */
367    public void addCause(String name) {
368      causes.add(name);
369      setText(textGenerator.apply(causes));
370      set(true);
371    }
372  }
373}
